body:
**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

/kind bug

**What happened**:
1. Start a cluster, And node1 with resource example.com.cn/foo:  1
2. Create DaemonSet, request  resource example.com.cn/foo:  4
```
        resources:
          limits:
             example.com.cn/foo: 4 
          requests:
             example.com.cn/foo: 4
```
run `kubectl get ds`, There is no pod created.
3. Add resource to the node:
```
curl --header "Content-Type: application/json-patch+json" \
--request PATCH \
--data '[{"op": "add", "path": "/status/capacity/example.com.cn~1foo", "value": "4"}]' \
http://10.46.178.168:8080/api/v1/nodes/10.46.178.168/status

curl --header "Content-Type: application/json-patch+json" \
--request PATCH \
--data '[{"op": "add", "path": "/status/allocatable/example.com.cn~1foo", "value": "4"}]' \
http://10.46.178.168:8080/api/v1/nodes/10.46.178.168/status
```
run `kubectl describe node 10.46.178.168` 
```
Capacity:
 cpu:                 3
 ephemeral-storage:   8662Mi
 example.com.cn/foo:  4
 hugepages-2Mi:       0
 memory:              3881908Ki
 pods:                110
Allocatable:
 cpu:                 2
 ephemeral-storage:   8174488768
 example.com.cn/foo:  4
 hugepages-2Mi:       0
 memory:              2755508Ki
 pods:                110
```
5. run `kubectl get ds`, There is still no pod created.


**What you expected to happen**:
In step 5, There is one pod created. 

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
see above description

**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):1.10.5
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration:
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):CentOS7
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
- Install tools:
- Others:

/sig app

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

title: DaemonSet didn't create pod after node have enough resource
